I always save the whole file in wav format then do my clips as mp3. Then I =
have the original for analysis. 
=A0
As far as pixelization of non sounds/w=
hite noise whos to say that isnt being manipulated by them as well LOL. Wat=
er is a form of white noise. I seem to remember some experiments done with =
blank tapes/film, no recording=A0done yet there were voices/images there. I=
 find it all interesting.
=A0
Just a thought. Ok off to work now!
Misty

--=
- On Sun, 5/10/09, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yaho=
o.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] File uploading rules
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.=
com
Date: Sunday, May 10, 2009, 11:47 AM












Be a bit careful of fo=
rmats like mp3 if you are doing a detailed analysis of the sounds though.=
=A0=A0 While some formats (like wav) can store the audio very close to the =
way it was recorded, formats like mp3 compress the file, and in so doing lo=
se some of the sonic details.=A0 This may not be a big deal in music, where=
 the audio is fairly clear to begin with.=A0 But with sound sources with a =
lot of noise (like evps), this can not only obscure any real sounds, but pi=
xelize non-sounds (like white noise) and make them start to sound like spee=
ch.

So mp3 might be good for sharing the data, once you've already formed =
an opinion based on an analysis of the wav file.=A0 But mp3 is not good as =
a medium for analysis.=A0 It can lead to many false positives and misinterp=
retations.
